title: 4 original tabs open in firefox but 12 in pc task manager
content:
I have many more tabs open in the background then I actually have. I am not good at this but I can give what I know I am experiencing. 1st photo has16 tabs open in pc's task manager 2nd photo shows that I only had 2 tabs open in Firefox browser 3rd picture show 19 in task manager. I expanded in task manager the Firefox app and right clicked to end task to remove what might be ghosts tabs running in task manager. ----That did not work There are currently 6 of them that has the efficiency mode on the 19 tabs.

Firefox is getting complicating for my abilities but I appreciate using Firefox for all the flexibility. I usually ask a friend to set me up or help but he is unavailable and this seems to be above his head to. Crossing my fingers for a easy solution. Thank you, Happycamper

title: I lost access to my synced profile after fresh OS reinstall and password reset
content:
Hi, I unwittingly reset my password without using a recovery key just now. My account had one recovery key in use but I completely forgot where I put it and I overrode it by skim reading through the warning before changing my password because I didn't remember it.

Thing is, prior to performing a clean re-install of my laptop, I didn't backup my appdata folder containing my firefox profile. The latest backup I have is from three months ago. I might be able to lay hands on my recovery key later today, but I need to know whether there is ANY hope of accessing that data on a server somewhere or if it's been wiped, definitively. I'm very upset because I had like a few hundred tabs and bookmarks.

title: Updates Disabled by System Administrator
content:
So I know this question has been asked and answered in various scenarios but so far I've not found one matching mine.

Personal PC. I'm on V 131.0.2 since a reinstall last year but only now realised no updates have been done since because of this msg. I've worked through the various fixes others used re policies, but I can't locate any policy files in the various locations suggested; registry editor (HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox key (don't have it) & others, about:config (nothing showing on a search), Program Files/Policies (don't have it), C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\Distribution folder (don't have it). So I could not find the offending poicy DisableAppUpdate anywhere in locations offered by other posters etc.

Rather than taking forever to pin down the culprit, can I not just manually update to the latest version or will that delete all my settings/extensions etc?? Given how often it's crashing I'm almost tempted down that road except that I like to have my History intact as I often want to find a site I've not bookmarked.

Thanks.

title: Sound looping bug
content:
A strange bug seems to have reappeared in Firefox 135.0.1 on Windows 11...

If I'm playing a YouTube video in the browser, and then reload the tab, the last fraction of a second of audio from the video will play on loop. It doesn't stop until new audio is sent to the WDM audio device (from any application).

The same thing can happen while seeking through a video. When the video playback resumes from the seek point, the new audio clears the stuck audio loop from the previous segment.

While I appreciate the unintentional tribute to Max Headroom, it does get a bit annoying.

Has anyone else encountered this?

title: email from breach-alerts@mozilla.com
content:
I received an email from breach-alerts@mozilla.com and wanted to know if this is from Mozilla or a scam.

It said it was from Mozilla Monitor and that I was part of a breach

Mozilla Monitor⁩ discovered the following data breach that includes your personal information:

Breach source: 

   Orange Romania

Your exposed data: 

   Email addresses, Partial credit card data, and Phone numbers

We’ll guide you step-by-step on how to resolve this data breach.

The urls in the email started with https://blrv1ly5.r.us-west-2.awstrack.me, for example:

https://blrv1ly5.r.us-west-2.awstrack.me/L0/https:%2F%2Fmonitor.mozilla.org%2Fuser%2Fdashboard%2Faction-needed%2F%3Futm_source=monitor-product%26utm_medium=product-email%26utm_campaign=breach-alert-free-us-no-scan%26utm_content=lets-get-started-us/1/010101954707497e-60e09c39-3a6c-4790-9ec8-1e6c480be653-000000/vhuplzy93ytOGWRRt1XRPcDqVKM=416

title: Browser issues
content:
I have used Firefox for a very long time and have always been very happy with it, but lately I am having more and more problems. I have Firefox installed on multiple devices.

On my iPad it no longer lets me stay logged in to websites. No matter what I do with privacy or cookie settings I constantly have to re login to every site I visit, even if I haven't closed the browser. I also cannot use paypal checkout for anything as clicking on the paypal button always opens a blank page instead of the page that would allow me to select my payment choice.

On my desktop sites I normally stay logged into rapidly have the data corrupted to I have to remove the cookies and re login, which defeats the purpose of staying logged in. By rapidly I mean immediately. I can only visit a site once before having to clear the cookies. On at least one site I visit I have not been able to log back in because I get a, "The verification result of reCAPTCHA was incorrect. Please try again." This is only on Firefox and only on my desktop. Nothing I have been able to do have fixed this. I just cannot use this site anymore with Firefox.

I have always been very happy with FIrefox and want it to continue to be my default browser, but the more I have to resort to other browsers for more and more sites the more I feel like I need to move on to something else. Is there a way to fix any of these problems?

Firefox is up to date on both devices. The desktop uses Windows 11 Home 64 bit. The iPad is up to date. The only extension I have is Malware Bytes on the desktop. No extensions on the iPad.

Thank you!
creator: littlediegito
